title: Convergys lays off nearly 150 in Wilsonville, rehires possible
text: Convergys lays off nearly 150 in Wilsonville, rehires possible Feb 21, 2017, 11:25am PST Industries & Tags Andy Giegerich Digital Managing Editor Portland Business Journal Share Andy Giegerich Digital Managing Editor Portland Business Journal Home of the Day Convergys had recently added workers to its Rio Rancho. N.M., offices. Dan Mayfield | Albuquerque Business First A Wilsonville "customer experience outsourcing" branch for the international firm Convergys said Tuesday it's laying off as many as 143 workers. Convergys, in a letter to the state's Dislocated Worker Unit, said it's closing a client program that's based in the Portland suburb. Convergys had recently added workers to its Rio Rancho. N.M., offices. Dan Mayfield | Albuquerque Business First The Cincinnati-based company (NYSE: CVG) offers "customer management and information management products, primarily to large corporations," according to its Wikipedia page. The Wilsonville program is expected to close May 5. However, the company plans to retain its presence at the site and is encouraging those affected by the layoffs to apply for other positions with the company. The current changes will affect 108 technical support associates along with nine tech support team leaders, among others. Convergys traded around the $24 mark on Tuesday, off slightly for the day and just above its 52-week low.
